SEARCH
Package grafiosch.common

Class ValueFormatConverter

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.common.ValueFormatConverter
public class ValueFormatConverter extends Object
Utility class for converting string values to appropriate data types and setting them on bean properties. This converter handles locale-specific formatting for numbers, dates, and times, making it suitable for processing user input from different locales and formats.
The converter supports:
- Numeric types (Short, Integer, Long, Double) with custom thousand separators and decimal separators
- Date types (Date, LocalDate) with configurable date formats
- Time types (LocalTime) with configurable time formats
- String types with optional empty/zero clearing
- Automatic type detection and conversion based on target property types
The class provides multiple constructors to accommodate different formatting requirements, from simple default locale formatting to fully customized separators and date formats. It integrates with Apache Commons BeanUtils for dynamic property setting on arbitrary objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • ValueFormatConverter

      public ValueFormatConverter()
      Creates a converter with default system locale settings. Uses standard date format and default locale number formatting.

    • ValueFormatConverter

      public ValueFormatConverter(String dateFormat, String localTimeFormat, char thousandSeparators, String thousandSeparatorsPattern, char decimalSeparator, Locale userLocale)
      Creates a converter with fully customized formatting options. Allows specification of date formats, time formats, separators, and locale.
      Parameters:
      dateFormat - the date format pattern for Date and LocalDate parsing
      localTimeFormat - the time format pattern for LocalTime parsing, null to use legacy Date handling
      thousandSeparators - the character used as thousand separator in numbers
      thousandSeparatorsPattern - regex pattern for removing thousand separators
      decimalSeparator - the character used as decimal separator in numbers
      userLocale - the locale for number and date formatting

      public ValueFormatConverter(char decimalSeparator, String dateFormat, char thousandSeparators)

    • convertAndSetValue

      public void convertAndSetValue(Object bean, String fieldName, String value, Class<?> dataType) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • convertAndSetValue

      public void convertAndSetValue(Object bean, String fieldName, String value, Class<?> dataType, boolean clearZeroEmpty) throws Exception
      Converts a string value to the appropriate data type and sets it on the bean property. This method handles automatic type conversion based on the target data type, supporting numeric types, date/time types, and strings with proper locale-aware formatting.
      Supported conversions:
      - Numeric types: removes thousand separators and parses using configured number format
      - Date: parses using SimpleDateFormat or converts from timestamp
      - LocalDate: parses using configured DateTimeFormatter
      - LocalTime: parses using configured time formatter
      - String: used as-is
      The clearZeroEmpty option allows automatic clearing of zero numeric values and blank strings by setting them to null instead.
      Parameters:
      bean - the target object to set the property on
      fieldName - the name of the property to set
      value - the string value to convert and set
      dataType - the target data type for conversion
      clearZeroEmpty - if true, converts zero numbers and blank strings to null
      Throws:
      Exception - if conversion fails or property setting encounters errors

    • getDataTypeOfPropertiesByBean

      public static Map<String,Class<?>> getDataTypeOfPropertiesByBean(Object bean)
      Extracts property names and their data types from a bean object. Uses reflection to inspect all readable properties of the bean and creates a mapping of property names to their Java class types. This information can be used for dynamic type conversion and validation.
      Parameters:
      bean - the object to inspect for property information
      Returns:
      a map containing property names as keys and their Class types as values
